description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qfkk","text":"This protocol details a method for extracting proteins from ~5mg of powdered dental enamel for proteomic analysis by LC-MS/MS. This procedure includes the use of alkylating and reducing agents, a sample cleanup step, and features the optional addition of synthetic peptide heavy standards for absolute quantification and quality control of the analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r7h9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7qhm","text":"Total protocol duration is dependent on the number of samples to be processed. Protein extraction will typically take a day-and-a-half, after which time the samples can be safely stored prior to instrumental analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2drgj","text":"Always process blank samples alongside your enamel samples to allow for the observation of laboratory contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1ee7","text":"This protocol was used for analyses in the following publications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d47bu","text":"Jackson, V., et al. (in preparation) 'Following the thread: understanding the complexities of medieval Ypres’ spinning workforce using bioarchaeological and historical evidence'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Methanol for analysis EMSURE® ACSISOReag. Ph Eur

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5543","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fulq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"65utn","text":"Place your tooth on a fresh piece of weighing paper on a clean worktop. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dieg1","text":"Using a small drill bit, gently abrade the surface of the tooth crown to remove powdered enamel and collect it on the weighing paper.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"f4nmg","text":"Tip: label and weigh an Eppendorf tube for each sample prior to drilling. Use a fresh drill bit for each tooth and clean between uses to avoid transferral of enamel.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30q3t","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dvk5l","text":"Optional:  process additional, empty Eppendorfs alongside your samples to observe laboratory contaminants introduced throughout sample preparation (suggested 1:9).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bma7","text":"Carefully tip the powdered enamel into a protein lo-bind Eppendorf tube. Weigh the tube and record the weight of the powdered enamel inside.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u800","text":"Demineralisation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aidpi","text":"Add 200µL of 1.2M HCl to each sample tube. Vortex the tubes briefly to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14eed","text":"Incubate for two hours in a thermo-mixer, using moderate agitation at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c64im","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ph0a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ovtb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0vb7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2auhq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aodkf","text":"This section includes the use of hazardous substances. Be sure to wear appropriate protective equipment including a lab coat and gloves. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5o1kd","text":"The following extraction protocol is predicated on archaeological enamel quantities of ~5mg. Smaller or larger solvent volumes (where listed) may be required for differing sample weights.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ansk","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7iqpr","text":"Tip: process extraction blanks alongside your samples as contamination controls.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"au9c8","text":"Precipitation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99aj1","text":"Add 100% TCA (in water) to a final concentration of 33% (V/V) (i.e. 100µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"772f6","text":"Incubate on ice for one hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbcv0","text":"Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 15,000G at 0°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egonm","text":"Pipette off the supernatants and discard (or retain and freeze if desired).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abacb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3e4lc","text":"Wash the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qodr","text":"Pipette 500µL of ice-cold acetone into each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3kjuu","text":"Centrifuge for 10 minutes at 15,000G.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87an6","text":"Pipette off the supernatants and discard (or retain if desired).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20ntq","text":"Resuspend in buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8vk","text":"Add 200µl of 8M urea in 1M ABC buffer (pH 8).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75h8t","text":"Vortex and sonicate until all pellets are resuspended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsbn9","text":"Reduction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c69n3","text":"Add DTT to a final concentration of 5mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"codcd","text":"Incubate for 30 minutes at 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45v61","text":"Alkylation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aol6o","text":"Create a fresh stock solution of MMTS in 2-propanol (200mM).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30nan","text":"Add MMTS to a final concentration of 10mM in each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k5o4","text":"Incubate at room temperature in the dark for 15 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt7lv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8uv0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4nrhi","text":"MMTS degrades in light and must be kept in darkness before use. Try to minimise exposure as much as possible and only prepare the alkylating solution immediately prior to use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e80ca","text":"Digestion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daio3","text":"Prepare a solution of trypsin, or trypsin and lysine-C, in 1M ammonium bicarbonate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rqgm","text":"Add enzyme to a 1:25 (w/w) enzyme/protein ratio (around 1-2µg per sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qm9v","text":"Incubate overnight at 37°C. If there is visible debris in the tubes following digestion, sonicate until this is broken up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"at4jr","text":"Drying down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2lmf","text":"Vacuum-dry the samples. Drying at up to 40°C can accelerate the process without damaging the peptides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ntk6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ff99b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9j5us","text":"The samples can now be stored (refrigerated) in a dry state for transport or until it is time for LC-MS/MS. If storing for longer time periods (more than 2 days) it is recommended to freeze them at this point. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6cvd","text":"[Optional] Prepare a solution containing amelogenin heavy labelled peptide standards in 0.1% formic acid. Add heavy peptides to a concentration of around 5fmol/µL, depending on the LOD and sensitivity of the LC-MS/MS system. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fudr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m26n","text":"Add between 10-30µL of 0.1% formic acid [and heavy standards] to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dce2u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bvj4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hdct","text":"Sonicate and vortex the samples to ensure thorough solubilization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ot5t","text":"Centrifuge at 16,000G for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6872k","text":"The volume of formic acid in which you resuspend your samples will be dependent on the desired injection volume, and the sensitivity of the analytical instrument to be used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11rr7","text":"Transfer the samples to MS sampling vials ready for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ac6d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3k07c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6fq7n","text":"Tip: there may still be visible pellets in the bottom of the Eppendorf tubes. Avoid transferring any of this material into the MS vials. Should the pellet/s detach from the tube walls or begin to disintegrate into the supernatant, you may need to re-centrifuge the sample.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"141er","text":"Sample Cleanup via Solid-Phase Extraction [Optional]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ektrd","text":"Condition one Strata tube per sample with 1mL MeOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3361","text":"Equilibrate the Strata tubes twice with 1mL ultrapure water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rhpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjjqm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3lv34","text":"Remove the waste MeOH and water and replace the waste collection tubes with fresh Eppendorf lo-bind tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qplr","text":"Slowly load 1mL of sample per tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aasvt","text":"Wash twice with 1 mL of 5% MeOH in ultrapure water. [The cartridge can be allowed to run dry at this stage.]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t4if","text":"Elute the sample with 1 mL of 1% FA in MeOH; first let a small amount soak the cartridge for 2 minutes and then slowly elute the sample with the rest of the elution buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3hr2a","text":"Be careful not to let the filters inside the tubes dry out while conditioning, equilibrating, and loading the samples. It is best to stop draining the tubes ~1mm above the filter to avoid this. If a filter runs dry after conditioning, start over again.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ef5c5","text":"Buffer dilution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dek5r","text":"Dilute the samples to a final concentration of 2M urea with 1M ABC buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Protein Extraction from Dental Enamel
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"el40f","text":"This protocol includes the use of machinery and hazardous substances. Be sure to wear appropriate protective equipment, including a lab coat and gloves, at all times. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
